imagenetutils.dataloaders.get_pytorch_train_loader(data_path, batch_size, workers=5, _worker_init_fn=None, input_size=224)¶

train loader function

Parameters

  • data_path – image data path

  • batch_size – batch size in training phase

  • workers – how much workers we use

  • _worker_init_fn – initialize worker function

  • input_size – image size

Returns

(PrefetchedWrapper(train_loader), len(train_loader)): prefetcehd wrapper of training loader, and length of training loader

imagenetutils.dataloaders.get_pytorch_val_loader(data_path, batch_size, workers=5, _worker_init_fn=None, input_size=224)¶

validation loader function

Parameters

  • data_path – image data path

  • batch_size – batch size in training phase

  • workers – how much workers we use

  • _worker_init_fn – initialize worker function

  • input_size – image size

Returns

(PrefetchedWrapper(val_loader), len(val_loader): prefetcehd wrapper of validation loader, and length of validation loader

The following codes are from https://github.com/d-li14/mobilenetv2.pytorch

imagenetutils.eval.accuracy(output, target, topk=(1, ))¶

Computes the precision@k for the specified values of k

Parameters

  • output – pred labels

  • target – true labels

  • topk – determine k for top-k accuracy

Returns

res: accuracy for outputs and targets

The following codes are from https://github.com/d-li14/mobilenetv2.pytorch Some helper functions for PyTorch, including:

  • get_mean_and_std: calculate the mean and std value of dataset.

  • msr_init: net parameter initialization.

  • progress_bar: progress bar mimic xlua.progress.

imagenetutils.misc.get_mean_and_std(dataset)¶

Compute the mean and std value of dataset.

Parameters

dataset – input data

Returns

(mean, std): mean value of dataset, and standard deviation value of dataset

imagenetutils.misc.init_params(net)¶

Init layer parameters.

Parameters

net – input network to be initialized

make dir if not exist

Parameters

path – directory path we make

imagenetutils.visualize.make_image(img, mean=(0, 0, 0), std=(1, 1, 1))¶

image generation function

Parameters

  • img – target image

  • mean – mean value of the image

  • std – standard deviation of the image

Returns

np.transpose(npimg, (1, 2, 0)): unnormalized image

imagenetutils.visualize.show_batch(images, Mean=(2, 2, 2), Std=(0.5, 0.5, 0.5))¶

batch images showing function

Parameters

  • images – batch images

  • Mean – mean value of the image

  • Std – standard deviation of the image

mask showing function

Parameters

  • images – batch images

  • masklist – target masks

  • Mean – mean value of the image

  • Std – standard deviation of the image

  • mask – mask

  • Std – standard deviation of the image
